summary: This document is a series of email chains from 2019-2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel requesting and approving travel for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient and approver of multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team. He grants permission for travel and interviews.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Copied on multiple travel requests for the Epstein investigation, indicating she is part of the prosecutorial or investigative team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel approval requests for trips related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the header of the initial email chain.

connections.description: Tyrrell approves travel requests from Alleyne and the team for the Epstein investigation.
Tyrrell approves travel requests that involve Duncan as part of the investigation team.
Both are copied on travel requests and are part of the same investigation team under Tyrrell's supervision.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, on January 29th and/or 30th, 2020. This is noted as having an 'added international element'.

events.title: Planned Interview(s) in Los Angeles
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval to conduct an interview or interviews in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval to conduct an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval to conduct an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, planning to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The SDNY team requests travel approval for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida, in late May 2019.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: The SDNY team requests permission for travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein is referenced by case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The investigation involved extensive travel by the prosecutorial team in 2019-2020 to conduct victim interviews in multiple U.S. cities and internationally in Sweden.
Travel requests detail standard procedures like seeking approval, booking domestic carrier flights when possible, and reserving hotel conference rooms for interviews.
The emails show a consistent pattern of investigative activity focused on gathering victim testimony from late 2018 through early 2020.
The international trip to Stockholm in January 2020 suggests the investigation had leads or witnesses outside the United States.
